strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_high>*: (Squelch)
<se_high>*: It's no good! I can't move it. Even if I push as hard as I can.
<se_high>*: I'm not a bad slime, you know! Really! I promise!
<se_high>*: If you're looking for Grandpa Rydon, I think he's right at the top. He'll be busy carving his stones.
<se_low>*: ...Wha...!? You made it! All the way to the top, like!
<se_low>*: ...Ha ha hah! If it's that easy, I've got more building to do! Can't have a novice like you getting to the top!
<se_low>*: You're all right, young'un! I'm Rydon. And what do you want with a sculptor like me, eh?
<se_low>Rydon: ...You're looking for the Kran Spinels!? Ah, those old gemstones, is it?
<se_low>Rydon: They've been out of my family for donkey's years. I've never even laid eyes on them myself.
<se_low>Rydon: This is what I heard, like. One of my ancestors put them in a...ooh! Argh!
<se_low>Rydon: Argh, this damn back of mine! Always giving me trouble!
<se_low>Rydon: Anyway, I heard one of my ancestors used them in a statue she carved.
<se_low>Rydon: That's right... It was the pinnacle of her career, they say. Her best work.
<se_low>Rydon: Where's the statue now? I can honestly say I don't know. You'll have to find it yourself, young'un.
<se_low>Rydon: All I can tell you is the lady's name. If this old block of mine isn't letting me down, her name was Alexandra.
<se_low>Rydon: That's about it, I'm afraid. Unless there's something else I can help you with?
<se_low>Rydon: What!? My son said I should pay him a visit once in a while!? Ha ha ha! There's no time for that!
<se_low>Rydon: If a novice like you can get to the top of my tower, I've got my hands full here.<page>Rydon: I'll just have to build it higher! The only way is up, as they say!
<se_low>Rydon: Are you still here? I thought I told you I haven't got the Kran Spinels, didn't I?<page>Rydon: Like I said, they were used in a statue one of my ancestors made.
<se_low>Rydon: I can't tell you anything more than that. Other than her name, of course. Alexandra Kranbartle, it was.
<se_low>Rydon: Are you still here? I thought I told you I haven't got the Kran Spinels, didn't I?<page>Rydon: Like I said, they were used in a statue one of my ancestors made.
<se_low>Rydon: I can't tell you anything more than that. Other than her name, of course. Alexandra Kranbartle, it was.
<se_high>*: (Squelch)
<se_high>*: Oh, you're back! Did you go all the way up to the top!? Was Grandpa Rydon there?
<se_high>*: Busy with his stones, was he? Phew! That's a relief.
<se_high>*: He's been coughing a lot recently, you see. And I'm a bit worried about him. He's not so young any more.
<se_high>*: He wasn't there? Oh, no! I hope he's okay. I'd go up and see if he was all right myself, but I can't move this statue.
<se_high>*: I'm not a bad slime, you know! I'm nice!
<se_high>*: You know, Grandpa Rydon's been coughing a lot recently. I'm a bit worried about him. He's not so young any more.
*: Oh, you've come back! Grandpa Rydon's right up at the top as usual. He never ever comes down.
<se_low>Rydon: You again!? Are you making fun of me!? You think my tower's too small, do you?
<se_low>Rydon: You're standing on the fruits of forty years' hard slog, young'un. You can't just build something like this higher overnight!
<se_low>Rydon: What's that? You've got the Kran Spinels, have you? Well, it's congratulations then, I suppose.
<se_low>Rydon: Now then! I'm a busy man. If that's all you're here to say, you better leave me to it.<page>Rydon: Give it another ten years and then see if you can get up here!
<se_low>Rydon: I need to build this tower all the way up to the heavens if I'm to be able to look my ancestors in the eye when we meet up there.
<se_low>Rydon: A Kranbartle has a lot to live up to, you know! So go on! I've got to get my nose back to the grindstone.
<se_high>*: (Squelch)
<se_high>*: Oh, it's you again! Hey, I felt something evil pass by this way. Seemed like it was headed north. Did you feel it too?
<se_high>*: Maybe it went through the tunnel north of here.
<se_high>*: I'm a good slime, you know! Really!
<se_high>*: I don't know what it was exactly, but something evil past by here towards that tunnel in the north.
<se_low>Rydon: Ah, back to check on my progress, eh young'un!? Well I was just thinking of heading back home, actually.
<se_low>Rydon: You never know how long you've got before some other bloke'll be carving your headstone!<page>Rydon: I was thinking it would be nice to see my family again. It's been a long time.
<se_high>*: (Squelch)
<se_high>*: Oh, you've come back! Grandpa Rydon's right up at the top as usual. He never ever comes down.
<se_high>*: I'm not a bad slime, you know! I'm really nice!
<se_high>*: Grandpa Rydon's been coughing a lot recently. I'm a bit worried about him, you know. He's not so young any more.
